item.title: Tommy add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Tommy add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I have a theory that the truth is never told during the nine-to-five hours." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Tommy add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "The first time I managed to pick up a basketball I knew I was destined to lead the UK to another National championship. ... Even now, so many years later, I still believe Kentucky will go undefeated in March & win everything." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Tommy add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "I am getting so far out one day I won't come back at all." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Tommy add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "How I hate those who are dedicated to producing conformity." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Tommy add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "we are all alone, born alone, die alone, and — in spite of true romance magazines — we shall all someday look back on our lives and see that, in spite of our company, we were alone the whole way. i do not say lonely — at least, not all the time — but essentially, and finally, alone. this is what makes your self-respect so important, and i don’t see how you can respect yourself if you must look in the hearts and minds of others for your happiness" -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Tommy add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "The American uppermiddle-class citizen is a composite of negatives. He is largely delineated by what he is not. - pg. 41" -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Tommy add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "If, after spending time with a person, you feel as though you've lost a quart of plasma, avoid that person in the future." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Tommy add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "The air was soft, the stars so fine, the promise of every cobbled alley so great, that I thought I was in a dream." -- Jack Kerouac
